subject: Design
title: The London Underground Map: Simplicity Wins
description: A short lesson to help you apply The London Underground Map: Simplicity Wins.

hook.text: In 1931, London's Tube map was geographically accurate â€” and completely unusable.

buildup.text: Harry Beck, an electrical draftsman, proposed scrapping geography for a circuit-diagram layout.

discovery.text: He reduced the map to straight lines, even angles, and evenly spaced stations.

twist.text: London Underground rejected it at first. Riders loved it. It became the global standard.

climax.text: Every metro map in the world now follows Beck's design principles.

punchline.text: The best map isn't accurate. It's useful.

quiz.question: What did Harry Beck's Tube map sacrifice for clarity?
